definition[0]: the part of a circular track for racing that is nearest to the centre of the circle and is therefore shorter
definition[1]: a position that gives someone an advantage over the people they are competing against
example[0]: the inside track to success in business
definition[2]: if someone has the inside track, they have a position in which they have an advantage and are very likely to be successful
example[1]: The consortium now has the inside track for a project valued at more than $1 billion.
